website_summaries.verdict: An affordable digital luggage scale that will continue to perform for an extended period of time.
pros: Push-button control ensures seamless switching between units of measurement
Includes a flexible strap with a secure metal connection
Offers low-battery and error indicators for easy reference
cons: Scale display sometimes cuts in and out and resets to zero

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate for us
customer_reviews.text: This is not accurate. We tested it against items with a stated weight and compared with another luggage scale that is accurate. This scale is off by 2-3 pounds for a 20 lb load, gets worse the heavier the load is. Amazon is refunding me, but you may want to reconsider this purchase. I see most people give it 5 stars, but it sure isn't accurate for us.
customer_reviews.author: DeeWNY

customer_reviews.title: Junk...
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Never buy. It's been sitting idle for almost a year. After that I really needed to check the weight of a suitcase. Put in a fresh battery - just in case. It turned on right on, shown 0 after a second. But as soon as there is any pull on the hook, even the light one of less than a pound it turns off. Tried multiple times with the same result - turns right on but as soon as you pull just a tiny bit on the actual belt it's off. Useless. Way past Amazon warranty so I got 0 use of it - when I actually needed it I've got a dud...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The first time I used it, it worked, ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it, it worked, and when I tried to turn it off, it wouldn't turn off! I had to take the battery out to turn it off. While I was on my trip and headed home, I brought it out to check my luggage and this time it would not work at all. The display was blinking on and off and it would not weigh my luggage. Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: C. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: spend an extra couple dollars and buy a better one this one will just cause frustration the day ...
customer_reviews.text: Should have read reviews before purchasing. Literally worked less than a day. Frustrating as it's to late to purchase another scale. Worthless junk do not purchase, spend an extra couple dollars and buy a better one this one will just cause frustration the day before your flight.
customer_reviews.author: Tech auto

customer_reviews.title: A Picture Is Worth A Thousand Words
customer_reviews.text: It's a 8 lbs dumb bell. The scale is pretty consistent, I tried a dozen times, most of the time shows 8.1 lbs, I swear it showed 8.0 lbs twice. I also weighted a 3 lbs dumb bell a couple of times, showed 2.9 lbs. It will turn it off automatically after 60 seconds, which is an important feature IMHO, otherwise a lot of people would forgot to turn it off. The white print on the scale doesn't seem to be durable, I don't know how long it will last if use regularly or worn in the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Backyard Camper

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I took this with me overseas without first testing its accuracy at home. So I was really worried when reading reviews stating that the measured weight could be off by as much as 5 pounds and that my scale was showing that my suitcase was already at 49.2 pounds the night before my returning flight. Turned out it was pretty accurate based on what I saw at the airport when checking in the luggage. And this is easier to use than my last scale which has a hook. I would recommend the scale!
customer_reviews.author: Da

customer_reviews.title: Small and excellent
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this luggage scale above other portables I've used. This scale is truly portable whereas some are actually quite big — even though called portable they're quite clumsy and awkward. This is the smallest I've found that is easy to use and reliable when traveling. Luggage is easy to weight, even though the strap is sometimes a little fussy to attach to the case, and when the bag is on the scale, it doesn't slip off the strap. It's actually a very practical and reliable system of holding a suitcase or bag.
customer_reviews.author: Paul WR

customer_reviews.title: CR2032 battery
customer_reviews.text: this thing works fine, but two drawbacks: it doesn't have an auto-off function. So it just stays on until the battery dies. And the battery is one of those CR2032 coin batterys so I have NO replacements in the house. As a result, I've used this thing twice. Once, last year, when I first got it. And then when I went to use it this year it was dead. So I scavenged my whole house for a replacement battery, stole it out of some other poorly designed device, and used it once again. And then it died again. Too bad it couldn't use a COMMON battery like a AAA. There's certainly space in the housing for it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hale

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sleek and a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product yesterday so I have yet to test it out in "real life", but after opening it and trying it out with a few bags in my house, I must say I'm impressed. It's very sleek and compact, and the display is just the right size. Being able to switch between pounds and kilos is a big plus. I love the basic black color and the strap seems to be well-built and sturdy. The entire construction seems very solid, in spite of its very reasonable price. I'm very happy with this product. If anything happens that changes my opinion, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Lauder

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for someone who is always pushing the upper limit of baggage allowances.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight scale that is easy to use. Seems reliable to me; I weighed my bag at home at 49.7 lbs and it weighed on the airline scale at 49.6 lbs. It often wants to default back to kg, after I set it to lbs, though, and if I don't notice it right away assume I'm well under the baggage allowance. And this scale makes it much easier than my old method, which was to weight myself on a bath scale, and then weigh myself holding my heavy suitcase on the bath scale (as it never seemed to work correctly just setting the suitcase on the scale alone).
customer_reviews.author: abky

customer_reviews.title: Warning, the battery doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I like being able to easily switch between pounds and kilos, and I like the strap for holding the handle of the item to weigh. I don't like that you have to hold the item up for what feels like forever for the weight to lock in. Plus, it chews batteries, in weighing one suitcase, one carryon, and one backpack (admittedly, several times each as I needed to ensure the weight of each would meet the airline limits), I went through two batteries before I finished. Actually, I just crossed my fingers and hoped they were within the limits as I didn't have time to get another battery...
customer_reviews.author: Chic

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk
customer_reviews.text: You get what you paid for I guess. It broke after first use. If you try to weigh any luggage heavier than 10kg it shuts off, it looks like some electrical connector is not tight enough or something. I am disappointed that Amazon would put their name to such a shoddy product.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Chen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after using couple days
customer_reviews.text: It was great when it first arrived -- the weight was accurate to measure my suitcases for travel. I then put it away for about a week, and when I tried to use it again, it kept shutting off with notification of "Lo" (Low battery?! WTF? I just used this item for only two instances!!!) Now here I am, just right about a month later, finally returned home where I kept this item's box, and it's 2 days after the return date window closed. Frankly, Amazon's products are generally fine, but this was a dud. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jC

customer_reviews.title: Simple, portable luggage option...
customer_reviews.text: I had to weigh whether or not I wanted a checked bag with a luggage sensor built in or wanted a smaller scale I could take on a trip (and not add a lot of weight). This product provided the solution. It is fairly small--especially compared to the older mechanical model it replaced. It is simple to use. It appears to be accurate. I can throw it in a computer bag and it will be available when I have to check the weight on my larger bag prior to dropping it off at the airline's baggage counter.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Gay

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. I use it once every 3 months ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. I use it once every 3 months or so. Seems that every time that I use it the battery is on its last legs. --Now I am removing the battery after use. It would also be more convenient if it used AA or AAA batteries instead of the coin-sized lithiums so that you could use rechargeables. *** Updated from 3 stars to 1 star. Batteries die within a few minutes of use. Seems to be getting worse
customer_reviews.author: C is for Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, it's off
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. Used it the first time and I could tell it was off. On a 5 lb weight it is off by half a pound. On a 50lb piece of luggage it is off by 4-5 lbs. If I wanted a guesstimate I would just pick up the luggage and guess if it is within the limit
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Must have for travelers
customer_reviews.text: Why didn’t I buy this sooner? I purchased two. One for me and one for my parents. Before this we would have to guess how much our luggage was weighing. If it was more than the weight limit we distributed the weight putting things in another luggage or in our carry on Or even have to buy a new luggage at the airport. Now we don’t to worry about our luggage over weighing anymore because we know exactly how much they will weigh before we get to the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Rafaele C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. Super small. good for nothing. My first star 1 for Amazon product in last 20 years.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon who has been awesome in manufacturing it top of the line products that received always 5 start on all my reviews in last 20 years has seriously downgraded its reputation with this scale. Super disappointed. Back mark on Amazon and my first 1 star/ bad rating. I wish there were negative numbers for rating as it just does not deserves even 1 start. Complete rip off. Forget to wait 50 lb bag with this tini-tyni piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great travel scale to have on the Go!
customer_reviews.text: The baggage hand scale is very accurate, as I compared it to a larger scale that I keep calibrated. It is a great to have especially when traveling on vacations, you can get plenty of souvenirs and or items and still keep an accurate account of weight for your luggage so that you don't go over weight at the airport, which is a load off my wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Reikan Designs

customer_reviews.title: works very well to tell you the weight of your luggage, costs very little and stores well, battery where I live lasting a year
customer_reviews.text: love it, just had to replace battery but found it at ACE hardware. Lasted about a year before the screen read "LO" which apparently meant it needed a new battery. I just took the battery out at that time, wiped it off and blew on it, replaced it and it thankfully worked one more time as I was packing at the time and didn't have time to go buy a battery, but did replace it after my trip and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Debi J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe amazon endorsed this at all...
customer_reviews.text: This product is worthless. It changes itself from screen to screen or just crashes when you try to lift the bag as per instructions. Better off using a bathroom scale and doing the math...Highly disappointed- do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lark

customer_reviews.title: I use this too often for too many random things.
customer_reviews.text: Dunno what I was doing in life before buying one of these. I thought, "Oh, I can use this to ensure my bags dont go over 50lbs," and ended up weighing literally everything in the house. Its almost like a guessing game. I did use it for the bags a few times, as it was very accurate, to the 0.5lbs. Still im more interested in seeing what our TV weighs.
customer_reviews.author: Kray

customer_reviews.title: I cannot get a consistent weight no matter that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get a consistent weight no matter that I do or how many times I weigh my luggage. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Alise C

customer_reviews.title: Truly awful. Designers should be ashamed.
customer_reviews.text: This is awful. If you enjoy throwing out your back, then yes, get this terrible luggage scale. It is next to impossible to lift your luggage with it and get a reading. It takes forever for the scale to set on a number, meanwhile your back will give out. I only bought this because I lost my other one. This is a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: Avoid baggage fees and manage your luggage like a Boss
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. I bought this because if you get to the airport and you luggage is over weight, you have to re-pack and that just looks ridiculous. This is small enough to take on trips, so I can manage my baggage and avoid getting nailed for fees by the airlines. With airlines cracking down on weight, and not all airlines having the same policies, it’s more important than ever to be able to manage your own luggage to avoid fees. This will help. Construction seems solid and its easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: LA DIY

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to have when traveling
customer_reviews.text: A scale is a good tool to have when traveling, it can help prevent costly additional fees from airlines due to your luggage being too heavy! You can change type of measurements too in case you need too. It's tiny and travels easy. Uses gravity to do the weighing. You can also use for carry-ons or other things you may need to accurately measure.
customer_reviews.author: Midor1tora

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use & Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help with packing for an upcoming vacation. Gotta stay under 50lbs!! This is compact, easy to use and seems to be more accurate than me standing on the scale with my luggage and doing the math. Yeah ... And, we plan to pack it so we can see how much anything we might purchase will weigh.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Super Handy
customer_reviews.text: These are great for making sure you don't have any expensive surprises when you show up a t the airport with your luggage. Easy to use by 1 person (assuming you can lift the weight of your luggage with 2 hands) and accurate enough to avoid extra charges. Easy to keep in a small carry-on/briefcase/pocket/etc..
customer_reviews.author: ingow

customer_reviews.title: Can save lots of money when luggage weight requirements are effect.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! When traveling from island to island on different airlines with luggage weight requirements in effect, this handy dandy little tool is very cool. I finally bought one after I was charged a total of $95 for over weight luggage when I changed airlines and planes going to and from various islands in the Philippines. I actually ended up buying another suitcase for $120 because I kept getting stopped for overweight luggage. So now I carry this little scale in my backpack and use it every time I travel. I also use it to weigh larger packages that I have shipped. It is well worth the price. All my family members end up using it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 2

customer_reviews.title: works only a few times
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scale for 2 years, I've used it the day of travelling maybe 2 or 3 times each, each new trip I need to use it again I have to replace the battery, on my most recent trip it stopped working even with a brand new battery. This thing was used maybe 15 times, sat for months on end on a shelf, and failed...
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making sure you don't go over on weight on your luggage before you get to airport. Before I bought this I had over packed a suitcase and had to open my luggage up right there in the middle of baggage check and pull stuff out and put it in my carry on, it was a pain in the butt and wasted a bunch of time and embarrassing because I was holding up the line. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Blackaspitch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, bought this to weigh luggage while traveling. It feels sturdy and the ergonomic handle makes it easy to lift 50lbs and hold steady to get a reading. Over Christmas, it was useful to redistribute weight of some presents in our two bags to under the airline limits.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bienek

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Works almost perfectly
customer_reviews.text: After reading some bad reviews about battery life I was a little scared. Especially because this takes button batteries which I don't keep a stock of. I weighed my bags about 4 times before leaving for vacation (to make sure I was below the 50 lbs. limit at the airport) I did the same thing when returning from vacation and the batteries are still good. I was surprised at how accurate the weight was. I believe only decimal points off. Easy to bring with you. The weight will stay on the screen while you set the bag down which is nice if you can't look down while picking up the bag. I highly recommend this Scale.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: First scale was unreliable; replacement OK so far.
customer_reviews.text: The first scale I received was unreliable. It kept saying "Lo" battery, even though the battery was new, fresh, and had a full charge. It could take several tries to get an actual reading. We returned it and the replacement seems to work fine. I had expected that an "Amazon Basic" item would have a higher quality and have no need for replacement. Had the first scale worked reliably, I would have given it a higher rating. As I do not use a luggage scale very often, I hope the replacment still works the next time I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Ann

customer_reviews.title: battery died after 8 uses
customer_reviews.text: purchased this and barely used it and left it idle. i always turned it off after each use. displayed low battery sign aftter the 5th use and eventually would not give me any reading the 8th time. I know this because i have 4 luggage and i always weigh them twice. you are better off spending an extra couple of bucks on the CAMRY luggage weigher. this is complete and utter trash. the button protrudes so much that if you lay it down a certain way it can turn on. also if you put in carry on or luggage there is a high chance it will turn on and it will die and you are screwed on your way back.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlin

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product
customer_reviews.text: Used three times. On first two occasions the weight reading used to remain visible after luggage is kept down. This made it easy to read. Reset was required to take new weight. Now at third use, weight reading goes away as soon as weight is kept so difficult to see weight reading. Need two persons to check luggage weight now. Cheap product but the same time junk product.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh Agrawal

customer_reviews.title: handy scale for luggage and other things you can put in a bag
customer_reviews.text: I travel alot and im one of those people who take cheap airlines that have weight restrictions. anyways, knowing how much your luggage weight before you show up to the airport helps with packing. the scale is easy to use. power on, reset and kg/lb are basically the only button presses you get. you can also use this to measure other items. if i want to measure the weight of something else, i just place items in a light bag such as a plastic bag.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Weighs nearly nothing on its own.
customer_reviews.text: We were going to be cruising, and there was a limit of 50 pounds per suitcase. I needed a way to weigh the suitcases before we left, but also the night before we debarked (so that there would not be an extra charge for being over the 50lb weight limit.) This little gem allowed us to move a few things from one suitcase to another to make sure all stayed under the limit. Certainly worth the cost to save on future over the limit charges. Weighs nearly nothing on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Java_Woman

customer_reviews.title: Time and money and hassle
customer_reviews.text: When travelling for vacation, I used to guess at checked baggage weight. What a gamble. If you're wrong, you either pay for the mistake big time, or you do the nightmarish thing - open the luggage and see what you can remove. I don't worry about that anymore. The airport is hell on earth, this helps me manage those experiences better.
customer_reviews.author: AG&AU

customer_reviews.title: Light ,digital and affordable
customer_reviews.text: My husband travels a lot and always worries about to pay penalty for overweighted baggage. This scale is digital reading and very small, lightweight, does not take much space to store,unlike my old scale. Now my husband can take it along with him on trip and make sure pack baggage within weight limit. To test the accuracy, I weighted the same baggage three times and the the results are in consistency. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren W.

customer_reviews.title: Not so good for an Amazon Basics product most are great but not this one...
customer_reviews.text: Unit is cheaply constructed. There is a loose connection somewhere between the battery and unit and is unreliable. It was very accurate while it worked. Took this thing apart and tried to troubleshoot but the innards are pretty cheap. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: Portable, easy, and accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I used this scale on two medium-sized luggage that were being checked in, and the scale was surprisingly accurate to the tenth of a pound! One luggage was close to the 50-lb limit, so we were very glad that there were no surprises at the airport. I’m happy to no longer be one of those people repacking their luggage and moving items around at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not great
customer_reviews.text: It's good for a rough estimate, but not super-accurate. I took a trip with multiple bags, which were all a few pounds below the airline's threshold (according to this). But at check-in, the airline's scale had my bags over by a pound or two. I had to do some last-minute shuffling of items, which was not fun.
customer_reviews.author: TimTheEnchanter

customer_reviews.title: Great and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This scales worked perfectly on my recent overseas trip. I wanted to make sure that my carryon and checked luggage were within the weight limits. It’s lightweight and easy to pack. When I returned from my 12 day trip, the batteries died, so I would recommend changing them before your trip, because you don’t know how old they are when you receive the scale. The scale made it all the way through my trip though.
customer_reviews.author: Patti D.

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to take with you
customer_reviews.text: I carry a lot of gear on numerous international flights each year, and this is perfect for pre-weighing your bags before you get to the airport and having to re-distribute things. So, use it at home and take it with you , too.
customer_reviews.author: JP Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Those nasty airlines
customer_reviews.text: Airlines these days are really tough. Your luggage has to be the right size including handles and wheels. It must also be the right weight or you are hit with big fees. This little scale is perfect. No more getting on the scale naked and then reweighing with suitcase in hand while you, or in this case hubby, looks ridiculous. Now I can relax knowing I am well under the weight limits and it is portable too, easily fitting in your purse or carryon.
customer_reviews.author: sushicatlover

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my shopping trip to Florida. It was easy to use and correctly measured the weight of my luggage which needed to be 50 lbs or less....very efficient tool. I tested it with an eight lb weigh i had at home and it read it correctly....exactly 8lbs , nothing more or nothing less.....highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Saves me a lot of time trying to weigh my luggages.
customer_reviews.text: Saves me a lot of time trying to weigh my luggages. With this simple-to-use unit, I'm able to hook it and pull without trying to balance my luggage on the scale, or carry it on the scale then subtract my own weight. Great product..
customer_reviews.author: Maximammx

customer_reviews.title: 5 Years and Going!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scale for over 5 years and we use it when packing and while travelling. Very accurate! Has METRIC and US Standard System. It's lightweight and small so you can easily pack it with you while travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful when I travel
customer_reviews.text: This device has saved me from paying heavy baggage fees on several occasional. It has travelled with me to several different countries. It is sturdy and works well and is, as far as I have been able to check using the scales at the airport, accurate. If you are weighing something really heavy and bulky, it can be a little difficult to get a steady reading, but you at least know the weight within a pound or two. I will never travel without one again! Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Best Gadget For Travelers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after we took a trip, only to discover at the airport that one of our suitcases was over the limit by four pounds and the other was under by six. Costly mistake! There was no overweight baggage charges the next trip, thanks to this scale - it’s already paid for itself!! Packs easily, simple to use, it’s fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Works and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Used this for an International trip so I got to use both the standard and metric units. Works good and accurate to what the airline scales read. Pretty easy to use. Lighter than some others I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mazzone

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fast, and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a recent vacation trip so I could make sure all of our checked bags were under 50 lbs. Very easy to use, and appears to be accurate (compared to the scales at the airport check-in). Not too large, and fits easily in my carry-on bag. I'm glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Cohoman

customer_reviews.title: Travel a lot and this is great
customer_reviews.text: We travel a lot. Having a small, portable scale with us is helpful. We try not to pack too much, but sometimes we over buy on long trips. Having this little scale with us saves time at the airport. We can weigh bags in the hotel and be confident we are under the limits before we get to the airport.
customer_reviews.author: ilovefarmers

customer_reviews.title: This is a great device for travelers!
customer_reviews.text: Great for travel. I would always weigh myself on the scale and then weigh myself with the luggage and do the math. Well, now I don't have to do that anymore. This is a great device if you travel a lot or seldom travel. It could save you time and money.
customer_reviews.author: LueHam

customer_reviews.title: Great luggage scale but takes a few seconds to stabilize
customer_reviews.text: Great luggage scale! Even works for our huge 70 pound duffel bags to ensure we are not over weight before international trips. It does take maybe 10-15 seconds to stabilize and decide on the weight (fluctuates before settling on a number) so make sure you are strong or find someone who is to help you weigh your luggage. It is very easy to attach to your bag, though!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Must have for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Buy this and keep it in one of the bags you check at the airport. It is small and convenient, much better than trying to use a bathroom scale. You can always make sure you don't go over the 50 pound limit. The hook makes it super easy to use on any luggage with a handle or strap.
customer_reviews.author: Ansatz

customer_reviews.title: Battery was dead within the first week
customer_reviews.text: I really needed to use this item this past weekend. I had purchased it earlier in the week and it seemed to work the day it arrived. However, by the weekend when I was trying to use it, the battery was so low that it would just shut off. So this item failed when I really needed it. It's also really a low quality product which probably wouldn't have lasted very long anyway. I would avoid this purchase if I had it to do over again.
customer_reviews.author: Joey D

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scale so I don't experience any surprises when checking in. This scale actually saved me from going over the weight limits. I would recommend this to any traveling and having their bag checked in.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebomber

customer_reviews.title: Save money & time
customer_reviews.text: We live outside the US, but visit my parents in Florida at least once a year. As the airlines carry restrictions on size/weight, this has helped us tremendously in knowing how much our bags weigh. It also saves time, because we can switch things from a bag that is overweight to a less heavy bag at home instead of at the airport. Very easy to use and pretty exact!
customer_reviews.author: KJ Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely eliminated Baggage Over Weight Charges
customer_reviews.text: On a return flight from visiting my parents in Florida, I needed to bring home gifts. Having the scale with me allowed me to rebalance my luggage and avoiding overweight baggage charges. Space bags, a deflater, My Pillow, and this baggage scale are now part of my routine travel accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I make it through check-in every time without going over on weight
customer_reviews.text: Nice small scale. Easy to use. It seems to read what the scale at the airline check-in says. I bring lots of stuff home with me and so it is a great thing to make sure that my bag is not over.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: A travel basic MUST HAVE.
customer_reviews.text: If you travel enough you've surely over packed coming or going at least once in your life. These days that can be an expensive mistake, sometimes to the tune of a $100. This is a great investment or gift for someone who travels often, and can save you a lot of headaches...and $'s. Store's easily and neatly, is super simple to use, and an absolute must have if traveling internationally as every carrier can be different.
customer_reviews.author: WiscoSkip

customer_reviews.title: Small, accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my carry on luggage. It is very lightweight and small. When I am leaving my hotel room for the airport, I weigh my bags to be sure I am not over the limit.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in a while
customer_reviews.text: This is the best travel purchase I've made. I usually have 2 fully packed suitcases when I travel, and this has helped me adjust the weight of each accordingly. This scale is quite accurate and has saved me from paying overweight fees many times. If you travel often and usually check a bag, you absolutely need one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The concept and ease to use is great but the battery life sucks! I purchased two months ago and used on two trips only a few times (not something you need regularly) and while out of town it stopped working because the battery was low. Defeats its entire purpose
customer_reviews.author: Patrice

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself by avoiding overweight charges
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best! It seems super accurate. I used this before our trip to Peru to make sure our bags weren't overweight. I was able to shift stuff between my wife's bag and my bag to help keep us under the limit. On the return trip, we used this to overpack one bag in order to avoid paying double the fees for an overweight bag. I'm confident this paid for itself on the first trip.
customer_reviews.author: Max Melgarejo

customer_reviews.title: We recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This saved us at least $100 so far. It is very accurate and allows you to have piece of mind at the airport check in that you won't be charged for heavy luggage! Thanks for making a quality product. We recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fumble Fingers

customer_reviews.title: They send, i try to use it 1 week later and no battery, im on a travel, no time to buy new battery
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a plastic to release the battery and start to work, when i do i start my travel, 15 days lates try to use again and the product ON and when try to use it OFF, is battery.. so better to buy in shopping to ensure thats work
customer_reviews.author: Martin Ruffo

customer_reviews.title: Avoid overweight baggage fees!
customer_reviews.text: I had a little difficulty with it at first, the battery didn't seem to be secure so when I would pick it up it would turn off. I jiggled the battery and tried not to hold it right on the battery door, it worked fine after that. I like that it was small enough to bring with us and reweigh our bags after we added souvenirs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm, very accurate, and a must have for a frequent traveler of different airlines
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I purchased this for a recent flight to Europe that included several different flights that had some strict carry on and check baggage limits. I was able to throw this in a bag and weigh my bag each time I went to the airport. It worked like a charm and most importantly it was accurate. I would buy this again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Martinjm

customer_reviews.title: User-Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this digital scale when I needed to stick a bunch of presents in my suitcase and didn't want any surprises. It worked well from the moment I got it! It's very easy to use no matter the size of your suitcase. The one thing I will say about it is occasionally after turning it off, it reverts back to kg instead of lbs. So I would just make sure to check the display units when you use it. It folds up very small and is light weight enough to stick in your suitcase to take with you.
customer_reviews.author: Meesh628

customer_reviews.title: great deal this product is super useful when traveling overseas
customer_reviews.text: great deal this product is super useful when traveling overseas, you want to make sure you don't exceed weight limits because that will hurt you wallet and delay your boarding process, the device itself is nicely made and does the job, I ordered one but it came with a broken button, however, I reported that and they sent me replacement that worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: amz-customer

customer_reviews.title: Included battery dies really quickly.
customer_reviews.text: The battery died on my trip. I didn’t leave it on & I didn’t use it that much. Next trip I know to take extra batteries, but I’m surprised that I would have to.
customer_reviews.author: The Mysterious Woman

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What It Needs to Be
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what you'd think it might and it does it well. Perfect for traveling when you don't want to end up paying a ton extra because you went over by a few pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: These gauge take long time to get a reading. Just thinking of holding heavy luggage and waiting for the beep, it is not as convenient as we wish.
customer_reviews.author: A buyer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Mine lasted about a dozen uses. Would give errors, freeze, fail to turn on, and change metrics constantly. Also not a fan of devices that could use AA or AAA batteries but instead use obscure button batteries.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for frequent travelers
customer_reviews.text: Great accurate scale. For $8, you cannot go wrong and this is a must have item if you are a frequent traveler. I compared the readings from this scale with the scale at the airport and it's very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Baby Scale
customer_reviews.text: Way cheaper than buying a baby scale. I’ve been using this to keep track of my infants growth by weighing him in his car seat. You can buy replacement batteries at Dollar Tree.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate at 50 Pounds
customer_reviews.text: I tested this scale with calibrated 25-pound weights. 25 pounds registered 24.9 pounds and 50 pounds registered 50.0 pounds. This scale is lightweight and easy to use. Well, you have to be able to lift the weight. It also has a tare feature if you want to weigh things besides luggage, I guess. Using this will be better than trying to use the bathroom scale, or on the return trip finding out you are a few pounds over.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy.  Worth the price, small and convenient to carry
customer_reviews.text: Used this a lot while traveling. Even had friends use it right before heading to the airport and saved them a lot of money by knowing weight of their luggage. Very accurate, weighed the same as the airport scales. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How to use it
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I do not like about the product is that it has clock batteries instead of using AA or AAA batteries. For everything else it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Josue Monroy-GT

customer_reviews.title: An essential addition for Backpackers
customer_reviews.text: Works well for weighing packs and larger items. Accurate, easy to use, invaluable to keep your carry weight down to a manageable number.
customer_reviews.author: Navygray

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I got a few of these as stocking stuffers after my in laws let us use theirs while traveling. We found it to be very useful and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Cody and Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This luggage scale works great, and has helped my family avoid having the proverbial one bag that is over the limit with the mass “stuff shift” in the middle of the airport. If you travel frequently or with someone who has a hard time of leaving something behind on a trip, I would highly recommend you get this – it sure beats the $25 or more bag fees of the airlines.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat accurate, make sure it's zeroed before using.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cheap but it does the job. Make sure you zero it completely as it will function if it's not zeroed and it will give you an inaccurate weight reading.
customer_reviews.author: Omar A

customer_reviews.title: Pros: it does the job, very portable. ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: it does the job, very portable. Cons: clumsy, the bag tends to spin and for that reason the scale takes a while to lock the weight... which can be a challenge. My mother and girlfriend are not able to hold the luggage long enough to get a reading.
customer_reviews.author: Erik de Almeida

customer_reviews.title: handy little device for weigbing things you had not imagined....
customer_reviews.text: I had an idea having this luggage scale might be useful in other ways, like comparing weights of parts and wheels off my racing bicycle. It only does kg, lbs and oz. but to get grams thus remember that 1,000 grams is a kilogram.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Small, cheap, accurate, and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to collect data for math lessons in my classroom. I’ve weighed 180 backpacks a year for three years. I’ve weighed lawn chairs and catapults and a variety of things. I try to be careful with it, but it’s lasted well.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good tool. Not the smallest
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good tool. Not the smallest, a bit bulky. The battery cover tends to slip away and fall (not the best build quality). It does feel like it’s not going to hold a heavy luggage while scaling, but surprisingly it does. I weighted my luggage and it was 28 kilos and the scale was fine. For its price it does its work pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Nachimovskey

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend to give yourself a two pound buffer just incase
customer_reviews.text: Was a couple pounds off when compared to the airport scale which unfortunately cost me more when checking in. Used with the Amazon Basics large duffle, I would recommend to give yourself a two pound buffer just incase.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Great for international travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for an international trip. I bought lots on my trip and had to reorganized my luggage because I knew it was too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: After 2 trips, we realized that it shows 3lbs lighter than the Airport weighing machine. We had to scramble at the airport to take out the extra weight. So accuracy is not great.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Accurately weights luggage
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly although I wish that the weight would max out and blink for a few seconds so I could see it after putting the luggage down. Also, a handle above the handle would be easier to hold.
customer_reviews.author: RAE

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: So much easier than trying to get an accurate weight using a scale. Worth the money if you travel a few times a year or ever travel with someone who has been that person at the counter trying to redistribute weight between bags.
customer_reviews.author: Average joe

customer_reviews.title: Light weight scale. Does job well, but unlike ...
customer_reviews.text: Light weight scale. Does job well, but unlike other brand it doesnt make sound upon reading a scale, so eyes must be on the scale which can be quite challenging when lifting heavy luggage
customer_reviews.author: MKY

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use (as long as you can lift the expected weight) Accurate. We weighed one of our suitcases at home using this device, said 46 lbs. Delta checked the bag and it weighed 46 Lbs. Other, lighter suitcase, was off by 1 lb.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Must needed item for your travels
customer_reviews.text: Once I received this I tested it out with packed suitcases, backpacks, basically anything I could find within reach. This scale is very accurate and does what it says it will do. I really enjoy how it is able to switch from pounds to kilograms, which is useful for foreign country airports. It is definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Reviewer_007

customer_reviews.title: Good scale!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my carry-on because of the weight restriction. Very easy to use. Simply turn on and switch to which ever unit of measurement you want. Lift bag with strap around handle and wait for the scale to stop measuring(blinks). Reset by pressing he power button.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Worked
customer_reviews.text: It works but battery dies fast and on some of my bags I had do it a few times because the numbers kept bouncing around .
customer_reviews.author: Br0wn3y35

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Portable Digital Luggage Weight Scale
feature_bullets: Compact digital luggage scale helps avoid excess-bag-weight costs when traveling
Max load of 110 lbs (50 kg); Easy-to-read digital display
Flexible strap with secure metal connection
Push-button control allows for switching between units of measurement (lb or kg); Zero/Tare function instantly resets scale back to zero
Low-battery and error indicators for easy reference; CR2032 battery included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,009 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
